level.heading: Privilege inapplicable for spouses or domestic partners.
level.text: Laws attaching a privilege against disclosure of communications between spouses or domestic partners are inapplicable in prosecutions under subchapter II of this chapter where the defendant is or was married to the victim, or is or was a domestic partner of the victim, or where the victim is a child.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-306 rewrote the section, which had read as follows:

"Laws attaching a privilege against disclosure of communications between a husband and wife are inapplicable in prosecutions under subchapter II of this chapter where the defendant is or was married to the victim or where the victim is a child."
